title.narrative: OUTPUT 2 : SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH

description.narrative: Innovative models for health behaviour for optimal health service delivery: By 2018, MOH and selected counties with high maternal, newborn and child mortality have adequate technical and financial capacity to design, implement, monitor and evaluate models of positive health behavior change at household, community and health facility levels., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Health Systems Strengthening, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Salaries and Related Costs

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF GENDER AND SOCIAL SER GARISSA

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Innovative models for health behaviour for optimal health service delivery: By 2018, MOH and selected counties with high maternal,newborn and child mortality have adequate technical and financial capacity to design, implement, monitor and evaluate models ofpositive health behavior change at household, community and health facility levels.

description.narrative: Planning process of a nation-wide review of community health services (CHS) has been completed and data collection initiated. Coverage of CHS in Nairobi county increased from 8% to 62% with UNICEF supporting in various informal settlements. Turkana and Nairobi received technical and financial support towards county CHS bills. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:23/07/2018

title.narrative: % of Community Units conducting Community Dialogue and Health Actions days as per the national guidelines
coverage of community units in focus counties
Number of community health workers that underwent skills enhancement programmes to operationalize intergrated community case management (iCCM) through UNICEF - supported programmes
% of households in selected counties receiving services (iCCM, cMNH) at the household level from a trained CHEW/CHV

baseline.value: iCCM: Turkana 2%, Homa bay-100, Siaya 40% cMNH Turkana 0%, Kakamega 10%, Homa Bay 2%, Garissa 0%, Nairobi 30%

target.value: 2018:iCCM: Turkana 50%, Homa bay-100, Siaya 100% cMNH: Turkana 50%, Kakamega 80%, Homa Bay 75%, Garissa 50%, Nairobi 100%
